~~VIM CTRLS (NORMAL MODE)~~
`Ctrl + y` - move screen up one line (without moving cursor)
`Ctrl + e` - move screen down one line (without moving cursor)
`Ctrl + u` - move back 1/2 a screen
`Ctrl + d` - move forward 1/2 a screen
`Ctrl + b` - move back one full screen
`Ctrl + f` - move forward one full screen
`Ctrl + i` - go to newer position in jump list
`Ctrl + o` - go to older position in jump list
`Ctrl + ]` - jump to the tag under cursor
`Ctrl + a` - increase number by 1 (tmux uses this)
`Ctrl + x` - decrease number by 1
`Ctrl + g` - :f (`mappeable`)
`Ctrl + t` - tag stack (mapped as close buffer)
`Ctrl + ^` - switch buffer (`mapped as terminal`)
`Ctrl + j` - enter (`mapped as prev buffer, select cmp element, telescope select)
`Ctrl + w` - ...all kind of window shortcuts, one for tab
`Ctrl + r` - redo
`Ctrl + v` = square select
`ctrl + c` = gives info about how to exit vim `(mappeable, used for emmet immediate)`

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
===MAPPED KEYS===
~~NO PLUGINS~~
`ctrl + j` = prev buffer
`ctrl + k` = next buffer
`ctrl + t` = close buffer
`alt + a` = resize window
`alt + s` = resize window
`alt + d` = resize window
`alt + f` = resize window
`ctrl + h` = move window left
`ctrl + l` = move window right
`ctrl + n` = move window down
`ctrl + p` = move window top

`alt + j` = move code below
`alt + k` = move code above

~~PLUGINS~~
`ctrl + j  = select-Telescope-Element, select-CMP-Element
`ctrl + k` = next Telescope-Element, next CMP-element, next-Snippet-Checkpoint
`ctrl + l` = previous-Telescope-element, previous-CMP-element, previous-Snippet-Checkpoint 
`ctrl + ^` = terminal 
`ctrl + q` = quick fix (you could replace this)
`ctrl + s` = neorg telescope
`ctrl + )` = emmet king (trash)
`ctrl + c` = emmet immediate
`ctrl + e` = cmp close items
`ctrl + b` = cmp other option
`ctrl + f` = cmp other option
`ctrl + space` = cmp other option
`ctrl + g` = open terminal

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
~~REPLACEABLE~~
`S` = synonym for cc `used in swap buffers`
`s` = synonym for cl `used in swap buffers`
`Del` = (can be used as x)

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
~~VIM MAPS INSERT MODE:~~
`Ctrl + h` - backpace
`Ctrl + t` - move whole line to the RIGHT.
`Ctrl + d` - move whole line to the LEFT.
`Ctrl + f` - move whole line at the corresponding BEGGING.
`Ctrl + j` - begin new line during insert mode (insert mode)
`Ctrl + i` - equivalent as tab 
`Ctrl + o` - you can insert one vim command, and then return to normal mode. (quite useless, mappeable)
`Ctrl + w` - delete one word
`Ctrl + r` - weird menu, with posibilites = %: file name
`Ctrl + k` - karate characters (`mappeable`)
`Ctrl + u` - delete whole line
`Ctrl + a` - ?
`Ctrl + e` - write character bellow cursor `(used for vsnip, close the menu)`
`Ctrl + y` - write character above cursor `(mappeable)`

~~PLUGIN MAPS INSERT MODE:~~
`Ctrl + l` - create link neorg

check this list in help:
`:help ins-special-keys`
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
~~<LEADER> (SPACE)~~
<leader> + r  = :w
<leader> + q  = :q
<leader> + so = :so %
<leader> + t  = Toggle highlights
<leader> + c  = :find ~/.config/nvim/init.lua
<leader> + l  = <hop line>
<leader> + j  = <hop word>
<leader> + h* = <git hunk menu>
<leader> + e  = <tree toggle>
<leader> + g* = <...reserved for vim-fugitive>
<leader> + k  = <telescope buffer list>
<leader> + f  = <telescope find file>
<leader> + u  = <telescope historial>
<leader> + sp = <telescope colorscheme>
<leader> + st = <telescope livegrep>
<leader> + p  = <telescope Projects>
<leader> + m  = <telescope marks>
<leader> + :  = <telescope commands>
<leader> + ss = <luasnipUnlinkCurrent> (bug)

~~VIMIUM MAPPING~~
map `<c-j>` previousTab
map `<c-k>` nextTab
map `<a-q>` moveTabLeft
map `<a-w>` moveTabRight

map `J` goBack
map `K` goForward

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
~~LINUX SETTED MAPS~~
`alt + i` = move window left
`alt + o` = move window center
`alt + p` = move window right
`ctrl + alt p` = move window right
`ctrl + alt i` = move window right
